                                       'a "prepared environment" planned in '
                                       'advance to support independent, '
                                       'student-initiated work." In the '
                                       'classroom, children are free to select '
                                       "manipulative's of their preference and "
                                       'through curiosity and innate interest '
                                       'engage in learning activities of their '

                                       'Montessori Education is based on the '
                                       'principles developed by Maria '
                                       'Montessori, who opened her first '
                                       'school for children of low-income '
                                       'workers in an apartment building in '
                                       'Rome in 1907. The school was called '
                                       '“Casa Dei Bambini”, Home for '
                                       'Children.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'This first “Casa” was furnished with a '
                                       "teacher's table, a stove, a "
                                       'blackboard, some chairs, group tables '
                                       'for the children and a cabinet filled '
                                       'with materials that Montessori '
                                       'developed in her earlier career when '
                                       'she researched how to teach kids who '
                                       'experience some form of mental '
                                       'disability. \n'
                                       'Maria Montessori created the materials '
                                       'after she realized that students seem '
                                       'to understand complex concepts better '
                                       'when they engaged all their senses.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'Activities at this first school '
                                       'included personal care (such as '
                                       'dressing and undressing), care of the '
                                       'environment like sweeping, dusting and '
                                       'gardening. Otherwise, they were free '
                                       'to move around and play with the '
                                       'materials. Montessori did not teach '
                                       'herself but instead oversaw the '
                                       'classroom work of her teachers.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'Montessori observed that children '
                                       'showed episodes of deep concentration '
                                       'and multiple repetitions of the same '
                                       'activity. Given free choice, kids '
                                       'showed more interest in practical '
                                       'activities and the materials than '
                                       'normal toys, sweets or other rewards. '
                                       'Over time spontaneous self-discipline '
                                       'emerged.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'Montessori concluded that working '
                                       'independently children seemed to reach '
                                       'new levels of autonomy and become '
                                       'self-motivated learners. She began to '
                                       'see the role of the teacher as a '
                                       'facilitator of young human beings who '
                                       'are free to move and act within the '
                                       'limits of a prepared environment. The '
                                       'goal: to grow children to become '
                                       'independent and responsible adults who '
                                       'share a love for learning.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'Soon after Montessori herself and her '
                                       'ideas started traveling the world to '
                                       'inspired progressive thinkers and '
                                       'educators from all over. The '
                                       'inventors, Alexander Graham Bell and '
                                       'Thomas Edison, became early advocates. '
                                       'Later alumni include Jimmy Wales from '
                                       'Wikipedia, author Gabriel Garcia '
                                       'Marquez as well as the two Google '
                                       'founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'Today the term “Montessori” stands '
                                       'more for a method, than a school '
                                       'itself. The fact that it can be used '
                                       'freely by anyone led to a great '
                                       'variation of schools. Educators all '
                                       "over the world borrow Montessori's "
                                       'name, insights, and materials to '
                                       'organize kindergartens, elementary '
                                       'schools, special needs programs, or '
                                       'even full 12-year curriculums. Some '
                                       'parents use it for homeschooling.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'The following characteristics are '
                                       'shared among most programs:\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       '- Students are free to choose what to '
                                       'learn\n'

                                       'movement\n'

                                       'materials \n'

                                       'teach letters to children, '
                                       'preschoolers and toddlers by phonetic '
                                       'sounds rather than letter names. I '
                                       'teach the letters in an order that '
                                       'allows children / early readers to '

                                       '\n'
                                       'Introduction of the letters using the '
                                       'time tested Montessori 3 period lesson '
                                       'is implemented as follows:\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       '1. Identify the sounds of an isolated '
                                       'letter – “this is” \n'
                                       'In the first stage we will make the '
                                       'sounds of letters when we trace and '
                                       'write them, and we will also reinforce '
                                       'learning with objects that begin with '
                                       'the sounds of each letter.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'When we have identified the sounds of '
                                       'the letters we will see if we can '
                                       'associate/recognize the sounds of '
                                       'letters in stage 2.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       '2. Associate/Recognize – “show me” \n'
                                       'In stage 2 we see the group of letters '
                                       'that we previously identified the '
                                       'sounds of and show where a letter that '
                                       'makes a specific sound is upon '
                                       'request.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       '3. Recall – “what is this”\n'
                                       'In stage 3 we say the sound of the '
                                       'letter indicated upon request.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'Montessori Sandpaper Letters are used '
                                       'to introduce the names and phonetic '
                                       'sound for each letter in preparation '
                                       'for reading. Tracing a letter with the '
                                       'fingertips whilst making the phonetic '
                                       'sound provides a tactile sensation to '
                                       'form both a visual and sensory '
                                       'impression to reinforce learning. This '
                                       'also develops a muscular memory that '
                                       'will help your child’s hand and mind '
                                       'become familiar with movements '
                                       'required to form each letter and be '
                                       'useful when s/he starts to write.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'Montessori Sandpaper Letters can be '
                                       'purchased online or go to the '
                                       'description in my video at '
                                       'https://youtu.be/l4Y-J_mWfw0 for '
                                       'information on how to make DIY '

                                                     '\n'
                                                     '3. Recall – “what is '
                                                     'this”\n'
                                                     'In stage 3 we say the '
                                                     'sound of the letter '
                                                     'indicated upon request.\n'
                                                     '\n'
                                                     'Montessori Sandpaper '
                                                     'Letters are used to '
                                                     'introduce the names and '
                                                     'phonetic sound for each '
                                                     'letter in preparation '
                                                     'for reading. Tracing a '
                                                     'letter with the '
                                                     'fingertips whilst making '
                                                     'the phonetic sound '
                                                     'provides a tactile '
                                                     'sensation to form both a '
                                                     'visual and sensory '
                                                     'impression to reinforce '
                                                     'learning. This also '
                                                     'develops a muscular '
                                                     'memory that will help '
                                                     'your child’s hand and '
                                                     'mind become familiar '
                                                     'with movements required '
                                                     'to form each letter and '
                                                     'be useful when s/he '
                                                     'starts to write.\n'
                                                     '\n'
                                                     'Montessori Sandpaper '
                                                     'Letters can be purchased '
                                                     'online or go to the '
                                                     'description in my video '
                                                     'at '
                                                     'https://youtu.be/l4Y-J_mWfw0 '
                                                     'for information on how '
                                                     'to make DIY Montessori '
                                                     'Sandpaper Letters. \n'
                                                     '\n'
                                                     '………………………………\n'
                                                     '\n'

                                                     'numerals. Cumulative red '
                                                     'and blue tabs based on '
                                                     'the counting rods found '
                                                     'in Montessori classrooms '
                                                     'help preschoolers '
                                                     'conceptualize quantities '
                                                     'when they count the '
                                                     'segments of the number '
                                                     'rod as it builds up. '
                                                     'Groupings of illustrated '
                                                     'objects provide objects '
                                                     'to count before readers '
                                                     'encounter textured '
                                                     'numerals to trace with '
                                                     'their fingers and '
                                                     'intensify learning with '
                                                     'a sensory / sensorial '
                                                     'learning experience. '
                                                     'Learning of numbers can '
                                                     'also be further '
                                                     'reinforced as '
                                                     'demonstrated in this '
                                                     'number learning video by '
                                                     'tracing / writing each '
                                                     'number from 1 to 10 in a '
                                                     'Montessori Sand Tray / '
                                                     'Salt Tray.\n'
                                                     '\n'

                                       '1. Identify the sounds of an isolated '
                                       'letter – “this is” \n'
                                       'In the first stage we will make the '
                                       'sounds of letters when we trace and '
                                       'write them, and we will also reinforce '
                                       'learning with objects that begin with '
                                       'the sounds of each letter.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'When we have identified the sounds of '
                                       'the letters we will see if we can '
                                       'associate/recognize the sounds of '
                                       'letters in stage 2.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       '2. Associate/Recognize – “show me” \n'
                                       'In stage 2 we see the group of letters '
                                       'that we previously identified the '
                                       'sounds of and show where a letter that '
                                       'makes a specific sound is upon '
                                       'request.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       '3. Recall – “what is this”\n'
                                       'In stage 3 we say the sound of the '
                                       'letter indicated upon request.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'Montessori Sandpaper Letters are used '
                                       'to introduce the names and phonetic '
                                       'sound for each letter in preparation '
                                       'for reading. Tracing a letter with the '
                                       'fingertips whilst making the phonetic '
                                       'sound provides a tactile sensation to '
                                       'form both a visual and sensory '
                                       'impression to reinforce learning. This '
                                       'also develops a muscular memory that '
                                       'will help your child’s hand and mind '
                                       'become familiar with movements '
                                       'required to form each letter and be '
                                       'useful when s/he starts to write.\n'

                        'localized': {'description': 'Learn how to teach '
                                                     'phonics using the '
                                                     'successful Montessori 3 '
                                                     'Step Lesson also known '
                                                     'as the 3 Period Lesson. '
                                                     'This is Set 5 '
                                                     'introducing how to teach '
                                                     'the letters D, W, E and '
                                                     'N to children, '
                                                     'preschoolers and '
                                                     'toddlers using phonetic '
                                                     'sounds rather than '
                                                     'letter names. I teach '
                                                     'the letters in an order '
                                                     'that allows children / '
                                                     'early readers to make '
                                                     'many words with the '
                                                     'letters they have '
                                                     'learned early on in the '
                                                     'sequence. \n'
                                                     '\n'
                                                     'There are variations in '
                                                     'the sequence / order in '
                                                     'which letters can be '
                                                     'introduced to children / '
                                                     'early readers. This '
                                                     'video introduces the '
                                                     'fifth set of 7 sets of '
                                                     'letters that will be '

                                                     'Introduction of the '
                                                     'letters using the time '
                                                     'tested Montessori 3 '
                                                     'period lesson is '
                                                     'implemented as follows:\n'
                                                     '\n'
                                                     '1. Identify the sounds '
                                                     'of an isolated letter – '
                                                     '“this is” \n'
                                                     'In the first stage we '
                                                     'will make the sounds of '
                                                     'letters when we trace '
                                                     'and write them, and we '
                                                     'will also reinforce '
                                                     'learning with objects '
                                                     'that begin with the '
                                                     'sounds of each letter.\n'
                                                     '\n'
                                                     'When we have identified '
                                                     'the sounds of the '
                                                     'letters we will see if '
                                                     'we can '
                                                     'associate/recognize the '
                                                     'sounds of letters in '
                                                     'stage 2.\n'
                                                     '\n'
                                                     '2. Associate/Recognize – '
                                                     '“show me” \n'
                                                     'In stage 2 we see the '
                                                     'group of letters that we '
                                                     'previously identified '
                                                     'the sounds of and show '
                                                     'where a letter that '
                                                     'makes a specific sound '
                                                     'is upon request.\n'
                                                     '\n'
                                                     '3. Recall – “what is '
                                                     'this”\n'
                                                     'In stage 3 we say the '
                                                     'sound of the letter '
                                                     'indicated upon request.\n'
                                                     '\n'
                                                     'Montessori Sandpaper '
                                                     'Letters are used to '
                                                     'introduce the names and '
                                                     'phonetic sound for each '
                                                     'letter in preparation '
                                                     'for reading. Tracing a '
                                                     'letter with the '
                                                     'fingertips whilst making '
                                                     'the phonetic sound '
                                                     'provides a tactile '
                                                     'sensation to form both a '
                                                     'visual and sensory '
                                                     'impression to reinforce '
                                                     'learning. This also '
                                                     'develops a muscular '
                                                     'memory that will help '
                                                     'your child’s hand and '
                                                     'mind become familiar '
                                                     'with movements required '
                                                     'to form each letter and '
                                                     'be useful when s/he '
                                                     'starts to write.\n'
                                                     '\n'

                                                     'Letters can be purchased '
                                                     'online or go to the '

            'kind': 'youtube#video',
            'snippet': {'categoryId': '27',
                        'channelId': 'UCacnSUkviry5AkhtdlAkDNQ',
                        'channelTitle': 'CheriEbooks - Kids Learning',
                        'defaultAudioLanguage': 'en',
                        'description': 'Teach Montessori phonics and two '
                                       'letter Digraphs  / Montessori '
                                       'phonograms CH, EE and ER with this '
                                       'Montessori Phonics learning activity '
                                       'for kids which uses the time tested '
                                       'Montessori 3 Period Lesson. \n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'The Montessori 3 period lesson is '
                                       'implemented as follows: \n'
                                       '\n'
                                       '1. Identify the sounds of isolated '
                                       'phonograms – “this is” \n'
                                       'In the first stage we will make the '
                                       'phonogram sounds when we trace and '
                                       'write them, and we will also reinforce '
                                       'learning with words that include a '
                                       'given phonogram. When we have '
                                       'identified the phonograms we will see '
                                       'if we can associate/recognize the '
                                       'sounds in step 2. \n'
                                       '\n'
                                       '2. Associate/Recognize – “show me” \n'
                                       'In step 2 show a specified phonogram '
                                       'upon request. \n'
                                       '\n'
                                       '3. Recall – “what is this” \n'
                                       'In step 3 we say the sound of the '
                                       'phonogram indicated upon request.\n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'Montessori Sandpaper Letters are used '
                                       'to introduce the phonograms in '
                                       'preparation for reading. Tracing the '
                                       'letters with the fingertips whilst '
                                       'making the sound provides a tactile '
                                       'sensation to form both a visual and '
                                       'sensory impression to reinforce '
                                       'learning. This also develops a '
                                       'muscular memory that will help your '
                                       'child’s hand and mind become familiar '
                                       'with movements required to form each '
                                       'letter and be useful when s/he starts '
                                       'to write. \n'
                                       '\n'
                                       'Montessori Sandpaper Letters can be '
